title: Changing audio files.
body:
A friend of mine has somehow installed the japanese audio files on his version of league of legends, and it's probably one of the coolest things I've ever seen. Before I look into doing it myself, I was hoping I could get some more feedback on whether or not this is against the rules?
He swore it wasn't, but I've spent a few hundred dollars on my account and I don't want to lose it just for some cool audio files.

Edit: Clarity. Searching the internet has returned a bunch of mixed results, I've seen posts from rioters saying it's not a bannable issue, and I've seen posts from people who have been banned because of it.

replies.body:
Hey there,

As of this post LVOC is considered an allowed tool, but as with any modification to your client there is always a risk that Riot may one day decide these kinds of modifications are no longer allowed.

Use at your own risk, I personally do currently use LVOC  (Well, did before LCU)

Thank you very much for your response :)
Basically the same thing I was told in the ticket I submitted, I'm just left not being sure if hearing Japanese fiddlesticks going "HOHOHOHOHOHOHO" for a few weeks will be worth losing access to all the skins I've bought if my account gets banned lol.

Found a post involving Riot WookieeCookie on whether LVOC was acceptable to use, and it seems to have come back positive, can I get further clarification on this?


Riot WookieeCookie;
If all you've done is changed to the Japanese language pack then you will be fine.
Let's say in the future, if for some reason we did decide to officially stop the use of other languages in game and were prepared to do a ban wave, then we would start with a warning announcement first to let everyone know. But, that's a big IF we ever decide to do that. Although we don't officially support using other region's voice packs, a lot of Rioters do it here in the office too.
Lots of Weabo Rioters were very excited for the Japan launch and all those anime voice overs :D

Riot Sargonas
You are correct. I'm not sure why this support representative gave this answer, and I've asked for someone to look into it.
That said, this is NOT why the person in question was banned. It was for a mod/tool detection as they said, but it had nothing at all to do with a VO swap. That's all I can really say on the matter though, obviously.


Forum response
I am in no way defending OP's friend, however the Rioter clearly says "modification of voices and language is a modification of our client." He then proceeds to say that's the reason he got banned for.
However, in the first screenshot, the Rioter says that OP's friend was banned for exploiting bugs.
Why is there such an inconsistency?


Riot Sargonas
I honestly don't know. I'm not involved with European player support, so I can only speak to our rules and policies on what is/isn't ok to use, but not to the actions of the Player Support staff. All I can say is, sounds like there was some communication issues there between support and the player in question and I've pinged some folks who can hopefully help address it.


Hopefully you can understand why I'm worried.
